reviewText: BRILLIANT BRILLIANT BRILLIANT! I GET SOOO SAD WHEN I SEE CRAP LIKE EVERY SEASON OV "FULL HOUSE" ON DVD & THIS WONDERFUL FILM IS STILL ON VHS!! I LOVE THIS FILM! I DON'T KNOW IF I CAN EVEN DESCRIBE THIS FILM IN WORDS.. RUBIN, AN ANTI-SOCIAL SHUT-IN WHO DESPERATELY MISSES THE COMPANY OV HIS DEAD CAT.. ED, AN ANGER MANAGEMENT CASE NOBODY WHO IS LOOKING TO IMPROVE HIS SELF-WORTH & GET RICH QUICK TO WIN BACK THE HEART OV HIS EX-WIFE.. RUBIN GETS NO MUSIC UNLESS HE CAN MAKE A "FRIEND".. ED GETS NO MONEY UNLESS HE CAN BRING A NEW RECRUIT HIS SUCCESS SEMINAR.. THEY MEET UNDER CHANCE CIRCUMSTANCE & BEFORE YOU KNOW IT, THEY ARE LOST & STRANDED IN THE DESERT WITH RUBIN LOOKING FOR A GOOD PLACE TO BURY HIS CAT.. I DON'T THINK I SHOULD GO ANY FURTHER HERE, JUST IF YOU CAN, BUY A COPY OV THIS FILM! IT IS BEAUTIFUL ON SO MANY LEVELS, CINEMATOGRAPHY INCLUDED! I ACTUALLY WROTE THE WRITER/DIRECTOR TRENT HARRIS AND BEGGED HIM TO PUT THIS FILM ON DVD!!

reviewText: Here's great little nugget of weirdness.  Crispin Glover plays Ruben Farr, a reclusive slacker of sorts who lives in the motel owned by his mother.  He spends a lot of his time listening to Mahler, dressing in 70's clothes, and not much else.  His mother threatens to take away his beloved music unless he makes a friend, and so enters Ed Tuttle (Howard Hessmen).  Ed has his own problems.  See, he a part of an organization that makes money through some sort of pyramid scheme, and Ed has been less than successful in recruiting new members.  Ed also suffers quite a bit of verbal abuse from his ex-wife, Rula, played perfectly by Karen Black.Ed happens to meet up with Rubin, and they make a deal that if Ed will drive Rubin out to the desert and help him find the right spot to bury Rubin's dead cat, Rubin will attend one of organizations' meetings.  Things go awry, as they tend to do, and things start to really get weird.A low-key comedy that a number of people I know thought was stupid, but if you enjoy bizarre characters and offbeat situations, then you'll really like this movie.  Hessman is really funny playing off Glover's usual oddness.  This movie may not be for everyone, but after watching, I did find myself quoting a number of lines from the movie like "I am the king of the echo people!", "Man, it is el warmo out here.", or "Why don't you keep your hands off other people's refrigerators!"  Not available on DVD yet, but I'll keep looking...
summary: "My cat can eat a whole watermelon."
Title: N/A

reviewText: From the first second of the movie, it's amazing. The music is genius. The viewer immediately knows that Rubin and Ed will change their world. We meet Ed: a desperate fool obsessed with success according to the PPR - The Power of Positive Real Estate. He's got some big problems. We meet Rubin: The weirdest character ever known. He's got a dead cat in the freezer and zero ambition. He looks like a freak and gives "awkward" a new meaning. This movie shall not be forgotten, as VHS is the only appropriate medium for Rubin and Ed. Crispin Glover was the only appropriate actor for Rubin. Salt Lake City was the only available city for Rubin and Ed. The movie quotes are beyond classic. The Letterman appearance by Glover is essential. Rubin and Ed will amaze you.2.342
Title: N/A

reviewText: Words do not do this film justice. It has to be seen to be understood. Either you will watch it and laugh a lot or you will watch it and wonder who's idea it was to allow this film to be made. I am sorry for those that do not like it, because I truly believe they are missing out on something heavenly. It's an odd one, I won't mislead you. But, there are very few films like it and that speaks volumes for its worth. Give it a chance . . . After all, isn't watching Crispin Glover for a few hours all the entertainment any of us really need?
summary: "This is what happens when you leave the house"

reviewText: I saw this in Salt Lake City with some relatives. I laughed so hard it hurt. This is one of those classic films the way the best Marx Brothers or Monty Python stuff was. Much, much better than Mel Brooks. See this!
summary: One of the most original comic masterpieces of all time

reviewText: Very interesting but strange buddy movie. This movie isn't for everyone but it's a must have for Crispin Glover fans of fans of oddball comidies in general. Unfortunately this is not out on DVD and it probably never will be. Couldn't tell you why this has never been released on DVD, everything else basically is. This is definately worth having and it's getting hard to find so you might want to grab this classic cult comedy while you can.
summary: Andy Warhol sucks a big one
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of the most original and wildly funny movies I have ever seen! But it is more than that. There is a moment when Rubin and Ed finally bury the cat where Ed looks at Rubin and sees him crying and realizes that however strange Rubin is, he is another human being in anguish because he has lost the only thing that ever loved him. Later, Rubin sees the way Ed's vicious ex-wife treats him and, possibly for the first time in his isolated life, tries to reach out to comfort another person.And, by the way, I live in fear of the day my VHS tape wears out. VHS players are only about 2% of new player sales and will probably go the way of the 8-track very soon. Will someone PLEASE transfer this gem to DVD!

reviewText: It is a serious crime that "Rubin and Ed" is not a houshold name. Shame on our culture. This is a perfect movie.

reviewText: Great cult film that needs to be on dvd right now! For anyone who hasn't  seen it please, please go rent it somewhere-anywhere now or buy it-it's  worth the money. Hessman and Glover are a perfect duo. I have seen few  films like this one and I wish there were more. it is very odd, very  strange and often totally hilarious.
